div.style: background-size: cover; background-position: center center; background-image: url(https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-86lXF5MB3ufGKUm4NV4VOiQ7SSbCg19z-_WWnm6fM9ZTI0ktQNhYhksflglK1ksGymaZyU=w16383);

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: On Thursday, the Governor of Missouri announced that all public and charter schools will close for the remainder of the school year. This means all sports and other events are cancelled. The Van Buren R-1 School District will continue to provide learning packets until May 20th. Be sure to let your child’s teacher know if you would prefer to have a paper version mailed to you. The meal program will resume Tuesday, April 14th. Going forward, the same number of weekly meals will be delivered to the same locations as before, just on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

We hope to answer questions concerning the Senior class and other aspects in the near future. As always, please reach out to your child’s teacher or administration if you need anything. We hope that you stay healthy and safe.
TO THE PATRONS OF THE VAN BUREN R-1 SCHOOL DISTRICT

This afternoon the Van Buren R-1 School District was notified that an employee of OPAA has tested positive for the flu. As a precaution this individual was tested for the COVID-19 virus. Under recommendations from the Center of Disease Control and the Carter County Health Center any coworker that was in contact with this employee will self-quarantine until the results of the COVID-19 test are returned. With these precautions in place, I am also announcing the meal delivery offered from the Van Buren R-1 School District will cease for the time being. Hopefully we may start again in the middle of next week. Please check with other local agencies about other feeding programs. These are precautionary actions and no one from the R-1 District or OPAA has tested positive. We are simply waiting on the test results scheduled to be in by next Tuesday.
Van Buren R-1 School District Public Announcement

In compliance with Local, State and Federal Guidelines concerning COVID-19 Virus the Van Buren R-1 School District will remain closed through May 1, 2020. With the ever changing needs of our community and the rest of the state of Missouri we will continue to monitor the information from our local Health Department and all levels of government concerning when we can again reopen. Please stay informed on changing developments and remain safe and healthy.

p.strong: To All Patrons of the Van Buren R-1 School District

The regularly scheduled Monthly Board Meeting for the Van Buren R-1 School District will be March 30th starting at 5:30 p.m. To protect the health of our patrons and Board of Education members, we are following our local health department and the CDC regulations concerning social distancing. Our Board Meeting will be broadcast on Zoom. The Meeting will also be recorded by computer in real time. These changes are in compliance to the Missouri Sunshine Laws for governmental meetings in a state of a Health Emergency Situation. To view the Meeting please follow the directions using your device.
Jeff Davis is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.
Topic: Van Buren R-1 Board Meeting March 30
Time: Mar 30, 2020 05:00 PM Central Time (US and Canada)
AFTER CLOSED SESSION THE SECOND ZOOM OPEN SESSION INFO IS BELOW:

ul.li: Topic: March BOE Meeting Open Session 2

div.p: Time: Mar 30, 2020 09:00 PM Central Time (US and Canada)

p.strong: Any questions concerning the procedure to log in please direct to:

div.p: The Van Buren R-1 School District along with OPAA will be delivering breakfast and lunch through this time of our school closure in response to the COVID-19 Virus. Breakfast and Lunch Grab and Go meals will be available to all students and children through 18 years of age. Parents and students have two choices to pick up their meals. From 10:00 till 11:00 A.M. Monday thru Friday a curbside service will be available at the main entrance to the Van Buren R-1 Gymnasium. Please enter through the gate at the Lower Elementary building and drive around to the main entrance where the meals will be delivered to your automobile limiting as much social contact as possible. The second choice is to pick up your meals at the designated bus stops throughout the district. A schedule is listed below with bus number, driver and time of delivery. A representative for the family may pick up meals for members, again limiting the amount of social contact.

We will start serving these meals Monday March 23rd. We will continue delivering on this schedule as long as needed by the community. Let us all work together to help each other in this time of concern and continue to monitor the District Website and Social Media for the latest announcements.
MENU AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS MESSAGE
Bus # 10 Dale Kipp---Meet at the Eastwood Community Center at 10:00
Bus # 2 Jim Dawson ---Meet at Yount Church at 10:00.
Bus # 1 Carol Sisler ---Meet at Fremont Post Office at 10:00.
Bus # 11 Tom Sensabaugh ---Will do a split meet at Crafton’s in South Town at 10:00 to 10:30 and at Houses Creek Church on M Hwy. from 10:30 to 11: 00
Bus #12 Roger Sisler ---Aldridge Valley and U Hwy. and old 60/Handle Mill Rd. meet at U Hwy. and 21 at 10:00 to 10:30 and County Line Hill at 10:45 till 11.
All cap factory kids and D Hwy. kids in town can go to school pick up service.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: To the Patrons of the Van Buren R-1 school district:

p.strong: As other school districts throughout the state of Missouri, the Van Buren R-1 school district is suspending all classes and activities until April 6th. This closure is in an effort to stop the spread of the COVID -19 virus. All school buildings will be closed except for essential personnel only and all events canceled or postponed until further notice. All classwork and assignments will be waived during the extended closure.

div.p: In the upcoming days a schedule will be posted on the Van Buren R-1 Website detailing a feeding schedule where we can as a district use our summer feeding program to distribute a grab and go style meal throughout the community. This will be a district effort involving school personnel and OPAA, our lunch program vendor.
These measures are in effect to ensure the wellness of our families and our community. Please stay informed using national, state and local resources.

p.strong: Based on current information, the VBHS Prom will be postponed until April 24th. There may be changes in the way the event is conducted for the health and safety of our students. Please be aware that this, as well as all events and school closures, are fluid and future decisions may be required. Thank you for your understanding and patience.

h1.div: Van Buren R-1 School District's Mission

h3.div: The mission of the Van Buren R-1 School District, in cooperation with the community, is to ensure that all students will learn in a safe and positive environment in order to become productive, future ready citizens.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.strong: In case of inclement weather leading to cancellations, bus routes and school events, you should receive an information call from school. You may also check the following:
RADIO: POPLAR BLUFF - KKLR, KJEZ, KWOC , WEST PLAINS - KSPQ, KWPM, KUKU, KKDY, KUPH, THAYER - KAMS

p.strong: Parents can make online payments for student lunch accounts, activity and athletics fees through the Parent Portal.

div.p: The Van Buren R-1 School District's School Wellness Program has an ongoing committee which oversees wellness activities and the development, implementation, periodic review and updating of the Local School Wellness Policy. Any one interested in participating in School Wellness Program and being a member of the committee should contact the school nurse and coordinator of the School Wellness Program, at (573) 323-4295, Ext. 9 for further information

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: The Department of Elementary and Secondary Education school counseling staff has compiled and placed information related to labor shortages and job attainment on their website.
